intro: Aquilegia sternbergii, commonly known as the desert monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, spurred petals. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces clusters of bright red or orange flowers. Aquilegia sternbergii is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
